sentence.Network_en: The old man is sleeping in a hammock hanging between two trees.
sentence.Network_cn: 那老汉正睡在两棵树之间的一个吊床上.

sentence.Network_en: It is difficult to turn over in a hammock.
We anchored the hammock to the tree.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们把吊床牢牢地系在树上.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (in the Spanish form hamaca): via Spanish from Taino hamaka; the ending was altered in the 16th cent. by association with -ock

entry.def: A hammock is a piece of strong cloth or netting which is hung between two supports and used as a bed.

means.word_mean: 2. a hanging bed of canvas or rope netting (usually suspended between two trees); swing easily
